entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 11:12AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STORM SYSTEM EXPECTED TO BRING INCREASED WINDS AND SURF TO COASTAL BRISTOL BAY WEDNESDAY... A frontal system moving southward through the Bering Wednesday morning is expected to bring increased winds and surf to coastal Bristol Bay. This is a change from what most of the summer has been so far with tranquil conditions. Winds are expected to
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bristol Bay

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 5:29AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Levels Continue on the Tanana River... The Tanana River continues to run near bankfull at some locations between Tok and Manley Hot Springs. Water levels on the Tanana River are expected to remain high through the week. Expect many gravel bars to remain underwater, with increased debris moving downriver.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 5:29AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...More Rain in the Alaska Range... Another moisture laden weather system is moving across the Interior and Alaska Range with additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 1.0 inch expected through Wednesday morning. Occasional rain is expected to continue through most of the week. Heaviest rainfall will be south of Kantishna and Healy in Denali
entry.cap:areaDesc: Denali; Eastern Alaska Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 5:15AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RAINFALL TO CONTINUE ACROSS SOUTHCENTRAL... After a brief break overnight, rain will return to Southcentral Tuesday morning and continue through Tuesday night before tapering to scattered showers for Wednesday morning. Expected additional rainfall amounts through Tuesday night: Anchorage Bowl: 0.50" to 0.75"
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound
